Subject: Editors, Publishers, and Readers-- What Rules to Break and Which Don't Apply
Description: Many new authors have heard the rules: One POV per scene, don't use adverbs, Limit the POVs to no more than three per story. These 'rules' have been taught for over a hundred years, but who came up with them and do they still apply to the modern reader?  Speakers include:Ann Leckie, Michael K. Elliot, Steven Saus, Tobias S. Buckell - Track: Literature  - Duration: 50 minutes

Subject: History in Speculative Fiction (and Other Literature)
Description: The historical details can bring a story to life or bog it down. What's the right balance?  Speakers include:Clif Flynt, Steven Saus, Nicole Castle, Robert Kroese, Michael Cieslak - Track: Literature  - Duration: 50 minutes

Subject: Acts of Shameless Self-Promotion
Description: What's the best way to get your name forward?  Speakers include:Dave Klecha, Michael W. Lucas, Jackie Morgan, Steven Saus - Track: Literature  - Duration: 50 minutes
